intro: Myristica crassithyrsa, commonly known as the thick-thyred myristica, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous fruits and distinctive, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by large, orange-red berries containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
